reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Roma womens power - Fostering the Inclusive Participation and Economic Empowerment of Roma women in Ukraine Moldova and Belarus
Romaninaisten voimaa - Romaninaisten voimavaraistaminen Ukrainassa Moldovassa ja Valko-Venajalla

description.narrative: The development goal of the project is to promote better opportunities for Roma women and girls to influence political decision-making and participate in economic activity in Ukraine Moldova and Belarus.The principal outcomes of the project are 1) Expanded space for Roma Women CSOs 2) Increased participation of Roma women and their CSOs on local Roma inclusion and 3) Increased economic empowerment of Roma women and girls. The central activities include establishing a Regional Network of Roma Women in Ukrain e Moldova and Belarus training of Roma women and girls for political participation through of the Roma Womens Regional Operative Program and increasing Roma womens and girls employability through the Program. The project contributes to the implementation of the Finland's development cooperation priority 1: The rights and status of women and girls promoting that Roma women and girls are included in political decision making and in economic activities. Finland has been pioneer in gender equality and civil so ciety has an established role in this field.The entire project is based on the acknowledgement that Roma women and girls face multiple and intersectional discrimination as a result of their gender poverty status and belonging to an extremely vulnerable com munity. As such the project aims both to reduce inequality and to promote gender equality. Project respects climate sustainability too.The project will be carried out by the Helsinki Deaconess Institute the main organization working with Roma migrants in F inland and the three Roma women networks from Ukraine Moldova and Belarus. The principal beneficiaries are 7000 vulnerable Roma women and girls (over 16 years) in three countries. Other beneficiaries are 100 Roma CSOs public administration in 30 municipali ties and 30 companies with potential jobs for Roma women and girls in the three countries.
